name: Fred Upton
summary: Long-serving Republican Congressman who voted to impeach Trump after January 6 and retired after Trump endorsed his primary opponent.

keyStatements.quote: The Congress must hold President Trump to account and send a clear message that our country cannot and will not tolerate any effort by any President to impede the peaceful transfer of power from one President to the next.
There was simply no excuse for the events of January 6th. The President's actions that day were simply unacceptable and warrant impeachment.

timeline.event: Chaired House Energy and Commerce Committee

timeline.significance: One of 10 House Republicans to vote for impeachment

credibility.background: Long-serving Republican Congressman, former committee chairman, moderate voice in GOP
positions: Chairman, House Energy and Commerce Committee (2011-2017)
